meanings.definition: A sale of merchandise at reduced prices to get rid of excess inventory.
meanings.sent1: During the closeouts, the store offered great discounts on many items.
meanings.sent2: I always look forward to the closeouts at the end of the season to buy things at lower prices.
meanings.sent3: At the closeouts, even the old stock found new homes with happy customers.
meanings.sent4: The closeouts were like a treasure hunt, with hidden gems waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The closeouts were so popular that people lined up outside the store before it even opened.
